topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
subtopic: Disclosure of Material Facts Affecting Property Value
question_text: The EPA-approved pamphlet, "Protect Your Family From Lead in Your Home," provides buyers and renters with ______.
A: A list of health centers that can treat the effects of lead toxicity
B: A list of homes that have been confirmed as containing lead-based paint
C: Information about identifying and controlling lead-based paint hazards
D: Information about the presence of lead in heating and cooling systems
explanation: The EPA pamphlet provides information about identifying and controlling lead hazards for people living in homes that may contain lead-based paint.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
subtopic: Licensing and Continuing Education Requirements and Procedures
question_text: In California, an individual performing real estate activities under the judgment or order of a court, such as a trustee in a bankruptcy, is ______.
A: An exception to the real estate licensing requirement
B: Required to have a broker license
C: Required to have at least an associate broker license
D: Required to have at least a salesperson license
explanation: This is one of the specific circumstances when licensure is not required.

topic: Contracts
question_text: In what way does good consideration differ from valuable consideration?
B: Good consideration is a promise to do something
D: Valuable consideration must always be in cash, but good consideration may be a loan.
explanation: Good consideration is a gift. For example, it could be a gift of a car from one family member to another.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which of the following describes the process of making a copy of a website for the purpose of obtaining money or data from unsuspecting users?
A: Backing up files to an external hard drive
explanation: While cloning can be one for legitimate business purposes (when the cloner owns both sites), illegal cloning involves copying a website to scam unsuspecting users.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Rhonda is considering what her niche should be. Which of the following would make the best niche for her to pursue?
A: She could focus on only residential properties.
B: She could focus on single-family properties that list between $300,000 and $500,000.
C: She could guarantee a sale at list price within 30 days.
D: She could start learning Spanish and serve Spanish-speaking clients.
explanation: A niche can be defined in many ways. Property value is one way to create that definition; a link to existing skills, hobbies, or knowledge is another way.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Kenny is updating a bathroom. Under what circumstances is a contractor's license required?
A: If he is not the homeowner and the work costs less than $500
B: If he is preparing his house to sell
D: If he is the homeowner and the work costs more than $500
explanation: Homeowners are exempt if they don't intend to sell. Work (including labor and materials) that costs more than $500 requires a license; however, disclosure that the person performing the work does not have a contractor's license is required.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Regarding documentation, which of the following actions can help a licensee avoid being accused of unauthorized practice of law?
A: Disclosing in writing to all parties in a transaction that the licensee isn't a licensed attorney, so there's no licensee liability
B: Having a designated broker review and notarize all completed contracts
C: Having a designated broker write all contracts from scratch to make them specific to each transaction
explanation: As a licensee, one way you can avoid inadvertently being accused of unauthorized practice of law is to use approved, fill-in-the-blank contract forms, and to always include an attorney review clause.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
subtopic: Licensing and Continuing Education Requirements and Procedures
question_text: What must be true for a corporation to conduct real estate activities?
A: All officers must hold a broker license
B: All officers must hold a salesperson license
C: At least one officer must hold a broker license
D: At least one officer must hold a salesperson license
explanation: Corporations must have at least one officer with a broker license. The officer must also act as the responsible designated broker-officer for the corporation. Other officers may be licensed brokers, but only one is a broker-officer.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: You've assisted the Juarez family with the purchase of a beautiful home in an established neighborhood. The sellers had owned the home since 1980. What's true about the amount of property tax the Juarezes will pay for their new home?
A: It will be reassessed because of the transfer, and the Juarezes will be taxed at 1% of the home's current market value.
B: It will be reassessed because of the transfer, and the Juarezes will be taxed no more than 2% of the home's current market value.
C: It will be the same as the tax the seller paid annually, according to Proposition 13 limits.
D: It will no longer be covered under Proposition 13 property tax limits due to the transfer, so the Juarezes may be assessed as much as 35% of the home's current market value.
explanation: According to the laws passed with Proposition 13, the property will be reassessed at its full market value when it transfers, but the property tax may be no more than 1% of that value. This becomes its new base value.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which of the following is the most severe potential consequence of failing to comply with regulations for the handling of trust funds?
A: Liability for damages to the client
C: License revocation and financial liability for damages incurred by the client
explanation: There are several potential consequences for failure to comply with regulations for the handling of trust funds.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Children and pregnant women are especially vulnerable to poisoning caused by what hazard?
explanation: Children and pregnant women are the most vulnerable members of a family to lead poisoning and its effects.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
subtopic: Disclosure of Material Facts Affecting Property Value
question_text: Which one of the following could be an indication of a foundation problem?
B: Doors that open and close easily
C: Lack of moisture in the basement
D: Windows that open and close properly
explanation: A crack in a basement wall can indicate a foundation problem, depending on the size/depth of the crack. Buyers need to know about issues with the foundation prior to buying a property.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which of the following should be avoided because it can attract thieves?
C: Posting photos of your clients' expensive belongings
explanation: Posting photos of your clients' expensive belongings can attract thieves.

topic: Contracts
question_text: What language may be included in a contract after the assignor's name to make it clear that the contract is assignable?
explanation: The phrase "and/or assigns" helps make it clear that the contract is assignable.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: What is the California Department of Real Estate responsible for?
B: Connecting consumers with real estate licensees
explanation: The California Department of Real Estate regulates real estate in California.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: A surveyor created a lot and block survey for a new residential development. What type of description was referenced during the first step of surveying the new neighborhood?
explanation: The lot and block system always begins with one of two types of land descriptions as a reference point: either a metes and bounds description or an rectangular government survey system description.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Identify the action that is illegal under California fair housing laws.
A: A landlord gives a tenant notice to vacate after she notices the tenant, a man, has begun dressing as a woman.
B: Brenda, a licensee, is learning Spanish to better converse with her Spanish-speaking clients.
C: Manny, a landlord, refuses to rent to motorcycle riders.
D: Tess, who owns a rental, refuses to allow waterbeds because of their weight.
explanation: Gender identity and expression are protected classes in California.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: The MLS offers several advantages to sellers. What's one of these advantages?
explanation: Broader exposure is the benefit here.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Licensees from different firms are tired of competing for the same listings. They divide up the city into territories so they don't step on each other's toes. What type of antitrust violation is this?
explanation: An agreement to segment the market between competing firms is illegal market allocation.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
subtopic: Licensing and Continuing Education Requirements and Procedures
question_text: Which of these real estate licensees may be exempt from the continuing education requirements for license renewal?
A: Al is 70 years old and has been licensed in good standing for 30 consecutive years.
B: Candice is 55 years old and has been licensed in good standing for 30 consecutive years.
C: Savannah is the broker of record responsible for supervising five salespeople.
D: Willard is 70 years old and has been licensed in good standing for 20 consecutive years.
explanation: Remember this as the 70/30 rule. Licensees who are at least 70 years old and who are licensed in good standing for at least 30 consecutive years are exempt from the continuing education requirements.

topic: Financing
question_text: What is a wrap-around mortgage?
A: One that involves more than one property
B: One that involves personal property in addition to real property
D: One that may involve seller financing
explanation: A wrap-around mortgage is one where the buyer's new loan wraps around the seller's existing financing. The seller uses a portion of the buyer's payments to the seller to pay on the original loan.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which of these statements accurately describes the formal DFEH complaint process?
A: A formal complaint is only filed if a full investigation reveals a violation of the law.
B: DFEH cases are litigated by private lawyers.
C: The formal process begins with filing of a complaint and ends with remedies. In the middle, you have investigation, pursuit of resolution, and litigation.
D: The process begins with mediation in an effort to avoid a costly investigation.
explanation: The formal process begins with filing of a complaint, then proceeds to investigation. If a violation is found, the process continues until resolution is found, which may be through litigation by the DFEH.

topic: Contracts
question_text: Sanjeev leases a house from Clara, and the lease has an option contract attached that permits Sanjeev to buy the house if he chooses to exercise the option within three years. How large does the option fee need to be in order to be legally binding?
C: Any amount agreed to by the parties
explanation: There is no minimum option fee-any amount agreed to by the parties is sufficient.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: When information is stolen from online real estate listings, what is it known as?
explanation: This practice is known as scraping, and the information is then used in online rental scams.

topic: Contracts
question_text: Which of the following requires that contracts transferring ownership of real property be in writing to be enforceable?
explanation: The statute of frauds requires that contracts transferring ownership of real property be in writing to be enforceable.

topic: Financing
question_text: How do the primary and secondary mortgage markets work together?
A: The primary market packages loans to sell to the secondary market.
B: The primary market regulates the secondary market.
C: The secondary market packages loans to sell to the primary market.
D: The secondary market regulates the primary market.
explanation: The primary market packages loans and sells them to the secondary mortgage market.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which act states that communities and facilities that meet certain criteria for providing housing to older persons are legally exempt from familial status discrimination?
C: Housing and Community Development Act of 1974
D: Housing for Older Persons Act of 1995
explanation: Under the Housing for Older Persons Act of 1995, housing must have one person who is 55 or older residing in at least 80% of its occupied units to be exempt from charges of familial status discrimination by age preference.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which of the following is true about the security of your clients' information?
A: Client data can be compromised if the brokerage's computer system is compromised.
C: Poor record retention ensures data security.
D: There is nothing a licensee can do to safeguard client data.
explanation: Brokerage and licensees are responsible for the safety and proper use of client information. Your clients' data can be compromised if the brokerage's computer system is compromised.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: A couple bought a house with a gas line easement on the property. An easement like this one placed by the utility company is an example of a ______.
explanation: Private land controls include covenants, conditions, and restrictions (CC&Rs); HOA or subdivision regulations; liens; and easements.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: What is the maximum amount that will be paid out of the Recovery Account for a transaction?
explanation: Payments from the Recovery Account are limited to $50,000 per transaction and $250,000 per licensee, regardless of the number of victims from the transaction.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which of the following is a true statement about the MLS and sellers?
A: For most sellers, listing on the MLS is not cost effective.
B: It's rare for sellers to decline advertising their property on the MLS.
C: Most sellers dislike advertising their property on an MLS.
D: Sellers are required to list their properties on the MLS if they're working with a real estate licensee.
explanation: In every listing agreement, sellers state whether they give permission for their property to be listed on an MLS. It's rare that sellers decline this opportunity, since the MLS is the most powerful tool that real estate professionals have at their disposal.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: A licensee refuses to show homes in a neighborhood with an aging demographic to a young unmarried couple with three young children. Which protected class status applies?
explanation: Familial status, included in the federally protected classes, includes discrimination when someone lives with (or is about to live with, in the case of pregnancy and pending adoption) a child under the age of 18 and is treated differently from others.

topic: Financing
question_text: Sondra, a buyer, signs all the required mortgage documentation, promising to make all payments to her lender. Unfortunately, Sondra falls on hard times and misses multiple payments, and the bank indicates that it's going to foreclose on her. The foreclosure proceedings are more difficult for the lender because Sondra holds the deed to the land. What kind of state does Sondra live in?
A: A deed of trust theory state
explanation: In a lien theory state, the mortgage becomes a lien on the property, but deed remains with the buyer. Foreclosure proceedings in a lien theory state may be more difficult for the lender.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
subtopic: Disclosure of Material Facts Affecting Property Value
question_text: Which type of pest may make mud tubes-tunnels that run along the walls-or shed tiny wings?
explanation: These are indications of termite infestation.

topic: Financing
question_text: If Acme Bank, a primary lender, wants to sell its loans on the secondary market, it would be easier for it to do so if its loans meet ______.
A: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac guidelines
explanation: If Acme Bank meets Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac guidelines, its loans are conforming and are easier to sell on the secondary market.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Jacob is a developer who purchased 78 acres and had it subdivided into half-acre lots. He decided to install sewer and underground electric for the entire subdivision, because he thinks that he will easily recoup his initial infrastructure investment. This is an example of which economic characteristic of real property?
explanation: Infrastructure installation is an example of permanent improvements to a property that upgrade the entire subdivision and reduce issues down the road. They can't be easily reversed. Thus, these types of improvements represent "permanence of investment."

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: ______ is the principle that the more similar properties are on the market, the lower the price.
explanation: If the competition is high, and there are many similar properties on the market, prices are likely to be driven down.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which of the following is a societal benefit of home ownership, according to research studies?
explanation: While research finds many societal benefits related to home ownership, community stability tends to be the main outcome that occurs, regardless of occupant age and income levels.

topic: Financing
question_text: Darrel loves working in the mortgage lending industry. On a daily basis, he works with multiple lenders to find and negotiate the best deals for his customers. What is Darrel's profession?
explanation: Darrel is a mortgage broker. Brokers work with multiple lenders and aren't tied to a specific suite of loan products, as mortgage bankers may be.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: What types of records must a California brokerage retain for at least three years?
A: Documents related to real estate activities that require a license
B: Documents that are handled by the brokerage but not provided to an escrow agent
D: Specific records the DRE has listed as being related to client funds
explanation: Records that must be maintained for at least three years are listings, deposit receipts, canceled checks, trust records, and all documents related to real estate activities that require a license.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Builders weren't allowed to develop new properties in Cityville for six months. This is likely because the city had enacted a ______.
explanation: A temporary halt on new building is a moratorium.

topic: Financing
question_text: When using an amortization chart, you use the interest rate and the loan term to arrive at a factor, such as 5.17808. Now what do you do?
A: Divide the loan amount by the factor.
B: Divide the sales price by the factor.
C: Multiply the number of thousands in the loan by the factor.
D: Multiply the number of thousands in the sales price.
explanation: The factor found where the term and interest rate intersect is multiplied by the number of thousands in the loan.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: What is the role of the Real Estate Commissioner?
A: Act as chief executive officer of the California DRE
B: Advise the governor on personal real estate dealings
C: Preside over real estate cases in court
D: Value properties listing for sale or rent in California
explanation: The governor appoints a Real Estate Commissioner to act as chief executive officer of the California DRE.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: A developer purchased 78 acres and subdivided them into half-acre lots. They installed sewer and underground electric for the entire subdivision, hoping to recoup their initial infrastructure investment. This is an example of which economic characteristic of real property?
explanation: Infrastructure installation is an example of permanent improvements to a property that upgrade the entire subdivision and reduce issues down the road. They can't be easily reversed. Thus, these types of improvements represent "permanence of investment."

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: What is one advantage of joining a real estate team within a brokerage?
A: Doing so allows you to specialize.
B: Joining a team offers higher commission per transaction.
C: Team membership gives you broad experience.
D: The cooperative agreement includes free advertising.
explanation: Team members usually specialize in one aspect of real estate and share commissions. Although the commission from individual transactions may be lower, overall commissions can be higher and may be achieved sooner because they are shared by team members.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
subtopic: Disclosure of Material Facts Affecting Property Value
question_text: When you perform a required visual inspection of a property, what will you be looking for?
A: Clues to possible physical defects, such as moisture stains, uneven floors, or cracks in the walls
D: Opportunities to improve the way the home is staged for showings
explanation: Your visual inspection should focus on red flags that would indicate a possible physical issue with the property. Anything that seems like a problem should be followed up with questions to the seller.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: One of the listing agent's main responsibilities regarding the TDS is to ______________.
B: Educate buyers of their option to waive receipt of the TDS
C: Educate the seller regarding the legal responsibility to complete it properly
D: Ensure that buyers do not see it prior to closing
explanation: The listing agent has a responsibility to inform the seller regarding the legal responsibility to complete it properly, make certain it is completed thoroughly, perform a visual inspection, disclose any issues, and deliver the TDS promptly.

topic: Financing
question_text: Recently retired Admiral Bongo and his wife, Lucy, contact you. They want you to help them purchase their dream house now that he's retired, but one that has the necessary accommodations for the admiral's disability. They also confide in you that they don't have a lot of money saved up for a down payment. Which type of financing may work best for them?
A: A conventional loan combined with a seller carry back.
B: A conventional loan using the admiral's retirement money as a down payment.
C: An FHA 203(k) loan to fix their new home up.
D: A VA loan, which requires no down payment.
explanation: Current and former members of the military may be eligible for a VA loan. Although the FHA 203K loan allows for renovation financing, VA loans require no down payment.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: A family with two young children is denied the opportunity to view an available unit in housing intended for older persons. Which of the following statements is true?
A: The federal Fair Housing Act allows an exemption for communities that are designed and operated for older persons.
B: The federal Fair Housing Act allows an exemption for communities that don't have playgrounds or play areas for children.
C: This is a violation of the federal Fair Housing Act because it discriminates on the basis of age.
D: This is a violation of the federal Fair Housing Act because it discriminates on the basis of familial status.
explanation: A familial status exemption is available for housing for older persons that meets HUD's requirements.

topic: Financing
question_text: Which statement describes a conforming loan?
A: A loan that fails to meet the criteria set forth by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac
B: A loan that meets certain criteria that are accepted by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac
C: A loan that requires a larger-than-usual, one-time payment at the end of the term
D: A loan to buy a high-priced or luxury home
explanation: A conforming loan is one that meets certain criteria accepted by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. Lenders who make conforming loans can more easily sell them on the secondary market, reducing their financial risk.

topic: Financing
question_text: Which of the following is the credit score range?
explanation: A credit score is a number ranging between 300 and 850; the lower the number, the higher the risk.

topic: Financing
question_text: An individual is purchasing a small craft shop, including the underlying real estate. She applies for a commercial loan from her federally insured bank to complete the purchase. Is this transaction covered by the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act?
A: No. Commercial and business loans are exempt from RESPA requirements.
B: No. RESPA only applies to loans obtained from private lenders.
C: Yes. All loans secured by real estate are subject to RESPA requirements.
D: Yes. Because the loan is from a federally insured financial institution, the loan is subject to RESPA requirements.
explanation: Commercial and business loans are exempt from RESPA.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: The ______ is a purpose-driven organization propelled by a passionate combination of entrepreneurial spirit, cultural heritage, and the advocacy of its members.
A: Asian Real Estate Association of America (AREAA)
B: Minority Real Estate Professionals of America (MREPA)
C: National Association of Hispanic Real Estate Professionals (NAHREP)
D: National Association of Real Estate Brokers (NAREB)
explanation: This statement describes NAHREP.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Which type of encumbrance would stop a homeowner from starting a gardening greenhouse because it sits next to a nature conservancy?
explanation: A physical encumbrance limits what can be done on the property and can decrease the property value.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Which of these statements about property tax in California is NOT true?
A: A change in ownership will cause the base value of the property to be reassessed using the year of transfer.
B: An improvement to a property that hasn't changed ownership, such as adding a swimming pool, will result in multiple base value years.
C: Certain improvements to property, such as a seismic retrofit, won't affect its base value.
D: If the property is sold, the base value will change but can increase by no more than
explanation: 2%. When property changes hands, in most cases it will be reassessed for a new base value year. The new value uses current market value, which may be much more than a 2% increase over the previous base value.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: A buyer knows the postal address of the property they're purchasing but are wondering about the legal description of the property. Where is the most likely place to find the legal description?
explanation: Legal descriptions, which appear on deeds and other legal documents, provide a less ambiguous and more complete description of a property than a street address does.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: When Henry first began his real estate career, he focused on residential properties. As he gained more experience, he found that he really enjoyed helping business owners find warehouses for their products, or properties where they could conduct manufacturing activities. Of the primary categories of real estate, what types of properties does Henry handle?
explanation: Warehouses and manufacturing facilities are industrial properties.

topic: Contracts
question_text: All of the following are true regarding implied agreements EXCEPT which one?
A: An implied agreement is based on actions or behaviors.
B: An implied agreement is based on a formal agreement.
C: With an implied agreement, it's possible that the other party didn't intend to be bound.
D: With an implied agreement, there's an increased chance of confusion.
explanation: An implied agreement isn't based on any formal agreement, either written or implied, between the principals.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Plants in a yard would be considered part of the real property because of the ______.
explanation: The method of annexation-planting in the ground-implies that the plantings were expected to stay with the land.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: At a closing, who orders, prepares and reviews closing-related documents?
explanation: The closing agent is responsible for ordering and reviewing the closing paperwork. Depending on local custom, this may be a broker, title representative/escrow officer, or attorney.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: In what way did the Supreme Court case of Brown vs. Board of Education affect the way fair housing laws are implemented today?
A: The court found that racially segregated school buses were unconstitutional.
B: The court legalized racial segregation through the "separate but equal" doctrine.
C: The court's decision made segregated school boards illegal.
D: The decision overturned the doctrine of "separate but equal."
explanation: Brown vs. Board of Education (1954) overturned a previous court decision that allowed racial segregation on the basis of the "separate but equal" doctrine.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: A property manager has just started working for a new property owner who owns a small apartment building. The property manager learns that construction of a large apartment complex has been approved one block away from his client's apartment building. What type of analysis would include this information?
explanation: A competitive analysis includes investigation into competing properties.

topic: Contracts
question_text: In a contract, consideration is the giving of ______.
A: Notice to attorneys that they may review the terms of the agreement
B: Something of value in exchange for something of value
C: Something of value in exchange for something without value
D: Thoughtfulness and courtesy to all parties
explanation: Consideration is the giving of something of value in exchange for something of value.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which of the following statements about advertising rules and technology-based media is TRUE?
A: Advertising rules apply online, just as they do in other media.
D: Only certain types of properties can be advertised online.
explanation: The same advertising rules apply online and in other formats.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: To develop a marketing plan for the property owner, the property manager should ______.
A: Compare the competition to the rates, condition, amenities, and location of the owner's property
C: Rely on the owner to do the market research
D: Take an existing marketing plan from an old property and modify it slightly
explanation: The first step the property manager should take in developing a marketing plan is to perform a market analysis by comparing the competition to the rates, condition, amenities, and location of the owner's property.

topic: Financing
question_text: An ARM usually offers an initial interest rate that's ______ a fixed rate mortgage for a period of time.
explanation: Initially, most ARMs will offer a lower interest rate than a fixed-rate mortgage. This rate applies to the introductory period, before the first adjustment kicks in.

topic: Financing
question_text: What is a unique feature of a VA loan?
C: The VA will guarantee a loan based on the sales price or the CRV.
D: VA loans can be used for investment properties.
explanation: When granted, the loan guarantee amount is limited by either the CRV or the sales price, whichever is lower.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
subtopic: Disclosure of Material Facts Affecting Property Value
question_text: Charles just learned that the master bath addition on the home he purchased was built without obtaining permits. It's actually situated too close to the lot line. What might Charles have to do to his master bath?
A: Get his neighbor's permission for the proximity to the lot line.
C: Since it's a bathroom and not a bedroom, he won't have to mitigate.
explanation: In some cases, unpermitted additions may need to be taken down if they don't meet code-which this one doesn't.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Law, Definition and Nature of Agency Relationships, Types of Agencies, and Agents
question_text: A broker has designated two licensees to represent opposing sides in the same transaction. One licensee represents the seller, and the other licensee represents the buyer. What relationship does the broker have to the buyer and the seller?
A: The broker is a designated agent to both the buyer and the seller.
B: The broker is a designated agent to the buyer and a dual agent to the seller.
C: The broker is a designated agent to the seller and a dual agent to the buyer.
D: The broker is a dual agent to both the buyer and the seller.
explanation: A dual agent represents both parties.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Ken, a licensee, has published an ad claiming that he can sell homes for 25% more than any of his competitors. The Federal Trade Commission determined this to be a deceptive ad. What might the FTC require Ken to do as a penalty for his deception?
A: Discontinue publishing any ads for one full year.
B: Live up to the claims in his ad within the next six months or go to prison.
C: Pay each client 25% of the sale price for every house he sells.
D: Take out new ads correcting the misinformation in his original ad.
explanation: The FTC may impose informational remedies designed to help consumers understand the deception that occurred. Ken will likely be required to take out new ads to correct the misinformation. He may also be required to include a disclosure in future ads.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: A property is listed as having four bedrooms and two-and-a-half bathrooms. However, when showing your buyer clients the property, you only count three bedrooms. As their agent, what should you do as part of your due diligence?
B: Demand the homeowner build another bedroom.
explanation: Licensees have the responsibility to investigate any discrepancies of a material nature. Number of bedrooms is material to the value of a property.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Responsibilities of Agent to Non-Client Third Parties
question_text: Which of the following is the most serious consequence of treating a customer as a client?
A: Breaching your duty to your actual client
explanation: If you treat a customer as a client, you could breach your duty to your client. For instance, if you provided client-level service to a buyer interested in your seller's listing, you'd be breaching the duty of undivided loyalty to the seller.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Which of the following is a means by which radon may enter a home?
explanation: Radon comes from the ground. Cracks in a basement floor can allow radon to enter the home.

topic: Financing
question_text: What is one way to improve your debt-to-income ratio without reducing your debt?
explanation: The debt-to-income ratio has two parts: debt and income. If you can't reduce debt, increasing income will improve your ratio.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: If a property owner dies intestate and no heirs or creditors can be found, what becomes of the property?
A: A lottery is held for ownership.
B: The property is combined with an adjoining property.
C: The property reverts to a former owner as recorded on the deed.
D: The state claims the property through escheat.
explanation: When a property owner dies without a will, the state may claim the property through escheat if no heirs or creditors can be found. Among other benefits, this prevents a dwelling from remaining vacant for years, leading to deterioration.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: How can you determine lot size, easements, and encroachments of a property? Select the answer that would provide the most comprehensive search.
A: Check the county recorder's office and local building board.
B: Research the deed and title history, check maps at the county recorder's office, and review land surveys.
C: Review subdivision maps, pace off the property, and check tax records.
D: Search the property's deed and title history, ask the neighbors, and pace off the property.
explanation: To determine easements, encroachments, and lot size, research the deed and title history, check maps at the county recorder's office, and review land surveys.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: One area of town has maximum building height requirements and setbacks for the front, side, and rear yards. These requirements are all indicative of ______.
explanation: These requirements are all indicative of bulk zoning, which may be seen in both commercial and residential areas, and which decreases density.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: Which of these statements is NOT true about an extended title insurance policy?
A: It covers some items that aren't part of the public record, such as unrecorded liens.
B: It's typically purchased for the lender.
C: It's typically used when the property is paid for in cash.
D: The buyer will most likely pay for this policy.
explanation: An extended title insurance policy is usually taken on behalf of the buyer's lender, so it won't be used if the property is paid for in cash.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
question_text: Gregory is looking for an apartment to rent for six months. He's hired Franklin as his agent to help with this search. Is Franklin required to provide Gregory with an agency disclosure form?
A: No, agency disclosure is only required for commercial transactions.
B: No, agency disclosure is only required for lease agreements exceeding one year in length.
C: No, agency disclosure is only required on sales of residential properties.
D: Yes, agency disclosure is required for lease transactions.
explanation: When working with a tenant, agency disclosure is only required if the lease agreement will exceed one year.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Which agency applies the "target" designation to a dwelling and has set specific requirements for lead abatement and remodeling of these homes?
D: The Local Lead Standards Designation Board
explanation: The EPA creates these designations and the specific requirements for contractors performing lead abatement or remodeling in these dwellings.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Which of the following is an example of a fixture that is real property?
B: Bathroom mirror hanging on a hook
D: Shelves attached to the wall with brackets
explanation: Shelves attached with brackets would be considered real property, since they're permanently affixed to the wall.

topic: Contracts
question_text: Which of the following scenarios best describes a net listing?
A: A condo owner is selling her unit for $480,000 and is offering a 6% agreed compensation to the listing broker.
B: A duplex owner lists his property at $600,000 but reserves the right to find his own buyer and not pay compensation.
C: A seller wants to get $550,000 for her house and tells her listing agent he can keep anything above that amount.
D: The owner of a townhouse is selling it for $425,000 and paying a brokerage fee of
explanation: $25,000. A net listing compensation involves compensation of an indeterminate amount and depends on the sales price. Net listings are illegal in several states.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Philip owns land in a state where growing marijuana is illegal. He wants to set up a small marijuana growing operation and export to states where marijuana has been legalized. He asks his attorney about the possibility. "No," his attorney explains. "It's not possible. Although you own the property outright, the right of ______ only allows you to manage the property in ways that are legal in this jurisdiction.
explanation: The right of control allows owner Philip to determine how the property will be used by himself or by others, meaning he can not only use but manage the property in any way he sees fit-as long as the enterprise is legal in the given jurisdiction. Other regulations, such as HOA regulations, may also apply.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: In investments, there are two types of depreciation, and each is defined by a particular event. Which of the following most accurately pairs the depreciation type with the event it is tied to?
explanation: Tax depreciation is tied to cost recovery.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: May homeowners perform work on their own properties without a contractor's license?
A: No, a license is needed for any work, no matter who does the work.
B: Yes, homeowners are exempt from contracting laws.
C: Yes, provided it is for a kitchen or bathroom remodel only.
D: Yes, provided the homeowner doesn't intend to sell right away.
explanation: Homeowners are exempt unless they are doing the work with the intent to sell.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: What can buyers do to protect themselves from title issues when purchasing property?
A: Ensure the seller's name is on the deed.
B: File a lis pendens claim at the court before buying the property.
C: File a security agreement at the county clerk's office.
explanation: Purchasing title insurance can protect buyers from any defects in the title when purchasing property. The seller's name on the deed could have been forged, so it's no assurance.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: A tenant rents a single-family home from its owner. What type of interest does the owner have in the property?
explanation: Property owners have a freehold interest in the property.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Responsibilities of Agent to Non-Client Third Parties
question_text: Which of these is NOT a duty that California licensees owe to the non-client principals in a transaction?
explanation: State law requires licensees to fulfill certain duties for non-client principals in a transaction. These include reasonable skill and care, honesty, fairness, good faith, and full disclosure of material facts. Loyalty is owed only to clients.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: You're a builder who wants to follow the national standards for measuring the square footage of a home you've built. Which of the following areas do you include?
B: An unfinished attic with six-foot ceilings
explanation: Under the national standards, neither unfinished spaces nor detached structures are included when measuring a home's square footage.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: Which economic principle says that value is created and maintained when the characteristics of a property fit in with its surroundings?
explanation: Conformity says that value is created and maintained when the characteristics of a property fit in with its surroundings.

topic: Contracts
question_text: When working with a seller, you signed a listing agreement that ensured you'd receive compensation provided the property sold during the listing term. What type of listing agreement did you sign?
explanation: It's easy to confuse these types of agency. With exclusive agency, the seller retains the right to find a buyer and avoid paying compensation. Exclusive right to sell agreements prohibit the seller from selling the property without compensating the listing agent.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
question_text: A seller decides to terminate her listing agreement and rent the property out instead of selling it after it's been on the market for several months with no offers. Assuming that her listing agent has fulfilled all of his responsibilities under the contract, can the seller terminate the contract before its expiration date?
A: Only if the seller and the listing agent mutually agree to terminate the agreement.
B: Only if the seller succeeds in converting it to a rental.
C: Yes, because the seller has not received any offers on the listing.
D: Yes, because the seller is entitled to terminate the agreement at any time.
explanation: Since the listing agent hasn't done anything to breach the contract, the seller's only options are to let the listing agreement expire or try to reach mutual agreement with the listing agent to terminate the agreement without penalty.

topic: Contracts
question_text: The buyer of Stan's house is only 17 years old, but no one knew until the boy's mother called the buyer's agent when she caught on to what was happening. Stan decided to ______ the contract based on the boy's legal incapacity to contract--or even pay for his house.
explanation: A rescission can be based on a lack of capacity to contract.

topic: Contracts
question_text: Real estate sales contracts must be valid, express, bilateral, ______, and executed or executory.
explanation: Sales contracts must be enforceable, which means they will hold up in court.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Law, Definition and Nature of Agency Relationships, Types of Agencies, and Agents
question_text: You have a listing agreement with Sam. Because of this, what is Sam's relationship to you?
explanation: An agency agreement exists, which makes Sam your client.

topic: Contracts
question_text: Ezra's lease on his condo includes an option to purchase. He told his landlord, Sherm, that he's ready to purchase the condo, and they've negotiated a closing date. What kind of contract is the option after it has been exercised?
explanation: Once the optionee exercises his option to purchase the property, the option contract becomes a bilateral purchase contract with obligations for both parties.

topic: Contracts
question_text: UETA supports the use of electronic documents and leaves the decision whether to use an electronic medium for agreements up to the _______.
explanation: Because the parties are the ones who are bound to the contract, they may decide whether or not to accept the use of electronic signatures.

topic: Contracts
question_text: In contract law, when does partial performance occur?
A: When a party acknowledges receipt of the contract
B: When a party does some, but not all, of what the party has agreed to do
C: When a party meets all terms of the contract
D: When a party rejects all terms of the contract
explanation: An example would be when a seller agreed to paint a house prior to closing, but neglected to paint the back side. A buyer would likely accept partial performance to close on time and may ask for a seller credit to pay for the additional work needed.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: Which term is defined as land that washes away and decreases the property size?
explanation: Think of revulsion and someone running away and you'll know avulsion is the process of land washing away and decreasing the property size.

topic: Contracts
question_text: Which type of contract is the opposite of an express contract?
explanation: An express contract is an agreement between parties where the terms are specifically outlined in words (either written or oral). An implied contract is an agreement that's understood but not specifically stated verbally.

topic: Contracts
question_text: A legally competent party means that an individual has the capacity, legally and ______, to enter into a contract.
explanation: For someone to be considered legally competent, that person must have the capacity, legally and mentally, to enter into a contract. This means, among other requirements, that the person is of majority age.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: What type of value is sought if an investor wants to know the estimated rate of return for a property?
explanation: An investment value can tell a consumer about the expected rate of return for a property.

topic: Contracts
question_text: Alex, a high school freshman, started a neighborhood lawn care business. Simone decides to hire Alex to mow her lawn every two weeks. Alex presents Simone with a written contract outlining the services to be provided and the fee Simone will pay. Which of the following is true in this situation?
A: Because minors can't enter into a contract, this contract is void.
B: Because this contract binds Alex and Simone to an obligation that's legal for a minor to perform (mowing lawns), the contract is valid and enforceable for both parties.
C: If both parties are content to uphold their agreement, the fact that it's not legally binding doesn't matter.
D: Minors can't enter into contracts, so Alex's parents are legally obligated to uphold the contractual obligations if Alex fails to fulfill them.
explanation: Because a minor can't enter into a contract, this contract is technically invalid, voidable, and unenforceable. However, if the neighbor and the student are content to uphold their agreement, the fact that it's not legally binding doesn't matter.

topic: Contracts
question_text: Which of these situations represents a unilateral contract?
B: Maurice promises Shelton $100 if Shelton will sell his painting. Shelton agrees, but
D: Nathan and Sue exchange vows at their wedding.
explanation: Sherry promises to give Brent a ride home from work, and then doesn't show up. A promise is a unilateral contract if there's no reciprocal promise. Breaching a contract in which one party performs isn't a unilateral contract.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
question_text: Anthony owns a new commercial strip mall with several units. He's hired Jillian as his agent to find tenants to rent each unit. Is Jillian required to provide Anthony with an agency disclosure form?
A: It depends on how many units are for lease.
B: No, agency disclosure is only required for residential transactions.
C: No, agency disclosure is only required on sales of commercial properties.
D: Yes, Jillian is required to provide Anthony with an agency disclosure form.
explanation: Disclosure is required. The number of units involved in the transaction is only relevant in residential property transactions.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: Which individual has a limited agency relationship with both a buyer and seller in a real estate transaction?
explanation: The escrow agent acts under a limited agency relationship to both parties of the transaction while the conditions of delivery are to be performed, and then as a limited agent to each principal once the conditions are met.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Disclosure of Acting as Principal or Other Interest
question_text: If a listing agent is interested in purchasing her own listing, what must that agent do?
A: Disclose to the seller that the agent is interested in purchasing the property.
B: Hold any other offers so the seller accepts the listing agent's offer.
C: Price the property above fair market value so the seller gets a better deal.
D: Price the property below fair market value so the agent gets a better deal.
explanation: In cases such cases, the agent must disclose immediately to the seller that the agent has an interest in the property. The agent must also properly market and fairly price the property just as she would any other listing.

topic: Contracts
question_text: The appraisal finally came in and it's lower than the sales price the parties have contracted; an appraisal contingency was in place, but the lender failed to meet the appraisal deadline. What happens now?
A: The buyer's earnest money is at risk.
B: The buyer will be sued for default.
C: The seller can sue for breach of contract.
D: The seller must reduce the sales price to the appraised value.
explanation: Deadlines are a big deal in sales contracts. If the deadline for the appraisal contingency has passed, the buyer cannot use a lower appraisal as a means to terminate and get a refund of their earnest money.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: Select the statement that correctly exemplifies the covenant term.
A: The covenant against encumbrances is the grantor's guarantee that he or she owns the property being conveyed.
B: The covenant for further assurances assures the grantee that there are no undisclosed encumbrances on the property.
C: The covenant of quiet enjoyment promises that the grantee won't be disturbed by a title defect the grantor passes on.
D: The covenant of warranty promises that the grantor has the capacity to convey title.
explanation: The covenant of quiet enjoyment promises that the grantee won't have his enjoyment of the property hampered by claims against the title.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
question_text: Jim from Greater SW Realty represents Andy as the buyer of a parcel of land. Roger, also from Greater SW Realty, has the listing for that land. Is this a dual agency situation?
A: No, because each party has their own representation.
B: No, because land is not subject to dual agency requirements.
C: Yes, because any time more than one party is involved in a transaction, it is dual agency.
D: Yes, because both Jim and Roger work for the same broker.
explanation: Remember that listings belong to the broker. The same broker represents both sides of this transaction.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: What is before-tax cash flow?
A: Cash flow after property taxes are considered.
B: Cash flow before property taxes are considered.
C: Cash flow before taking income taxes into account.
D: Cash flow taking income taxes into account.
explanation: The taxes in question are income taxes, and not property taxes. Before-tax cash flow is income without considering taxes.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Responsibilities of Agent to Non-Client Third Parties
question_text: To which of these individuals does California licensee Nadine owe the duty of reasonable skill and care rather than utmost skill and care?
A: Don, a seller, and Betty, a buyer, who have agreed to use Nadine as the dual agent in their transaction
B: Fred, the buyer offering for Ruby's house, who is represented by another licensee
explanation: Nadine owes customers in a transaction, like Fred, the duty of reasonable skill and care, and she owes her clients the duty of utmost skill and care.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: A homeowner specified in their will how title to the home would transfer. At their death, alternate conveyance occurred. What likely happened?
explanation: Operation of law trumps a will. It says that what's legally required must be satisfied before the terms of the will apply.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Law, Definition and Nature of Agency Relationships, Types of Agencies, and Agents
question_text: Jenny is selling her property and has hired Larry as her agent. After the property's listed, Jane brings her client, Andrew, to see the property, and he decides to make an offer. Who is Jane in this scenario?
explanation: Jane represents Andrew, the buyer, which makes her the buyer's agent.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: What "quick and dirty" investment formula seeks to achieve a percentage of gross monthly rental income as compared to purchase price?
explanation: There is a formula called the 2% formula that states that the gross monthly rental income should be at least 2% of the purchase price.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: What may an escrow agent disclose to outside parties to a transaction as a limited agent to both parties to a transaction?
B: The closing date of the escrow
D: The purchase price of the property
explanation: An escrow agent is not allowed to disclose information about the escrow transaction to outside parties.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: Which term is defined as someone claiming property of another simply by using it for an extended period of time?
explanation: When someone claims property of another by simply using it for an extended period of time it is called adverse possession.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: What's true about the documentary transfer tax in California?
A: Most real estate transactions in California don't incur a documentary transfer tax.
B: The county documentary transfer tax rate for the entire state is set at 55 cents per
C: $500 of sales price, and some cities add an additional transfer tax.
D: The documentary transfer tax is collected by the state, although cities may add an additional tax.
explanation: The documentary transfer tax, when used, is always paid by the buyer since the new deed is recorded on the buyer's behalf. The documentary transfer tax rate for each county in California is set by the California Revenue and Taxation Code. Counties may choose to charge the tax or not, and cities may also choose whether or not to charge a transfer tax at their own rate, whether or not their county charges one. Although the state sets the basic county tax level of 55 cents per $500 of sales price, it's collected by the county.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Law, Definition and Nature of Agency Relationships, Types of Agencies, and Agents
question_text: Rhonda is an unrepresented buyer who's purchasing Tony's townhome. Gary represents Tony in the sale of his property. What's Rhonda's relationship to Gary?
explanation: Rhonda is Gary's customer. She's not his client because no agency relationship exists between them.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
question_text: Rob is searching for a new apartment that he can lease for the next two years while he's working in the area. He has hired Danielle to represent him as his agent in this transaction. Is Danielle required to provide Rob with an agency disclosure form?
A: No, agency disclosure is only required on leases shorter than one year.
B: No, agency disclosure is only required on sales of residential properties with one to four units.
C: No, Danielle does not provide the agency disclosure to her client. He only provides it to the landlord involved in the transaction.
D: Yes, agency disclosure is required on leases exceeding one year.
explanation: Agency disclosure is required for leases exceeding one year.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Law, Definition and Nature of Agency Relationships, Types of Agencies, and Agents
question_text: When a licensee has the responsibility to handle all details of one specific transaction, what type of real estate agency relationship usually exists?
explanation: A special or limited agent has the responsibility of handling all details of one specific transaction. Listing agreements and buyer representation agreements are examples of special agency.

topic: Transfer of Property
question_text: ______ determines who the heir or heirs will be if a person dies without a will.
explanation: If a person dies without a will, the order of inheritance is called intestate succession. It's a predetermined priority of heirs based on close family relationships (i.e., spouse inherits first, followed by children).

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
question_text: When the listing agreement's purpose has been fulfilled, what happens to the agency agreement?
B: Agency continues until the agreement's expiration date.
C: The agency agreement terminates by completion.
D: The agent can renounce the listing agreement to terminate it.
explanation: Agency terminates when the goal of the agreement is completed. The duty of accounting remains until finished, and the duty of confidentiality remains forever.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Law, Definition and Nature of Agency Relationships, Types of Agencies, and Agents
question_text: You have an agency agreement with Sam to list his property for sale. Because of this, what is Sam's relationship to you?
explanation: An agency agreement exists, which makes Sam your client.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: Which of these principles of value is related to how a change to a portion of a property impacts the value as a whole?
explanation: The principle of contribution says that a change to a portion of a property impacts the overall value. For example, adding a swimming pool could add to the value for some buyers and detract from the value for others.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Law, Definition and Nature of Agency Relationships, Types of Agencies, and Agents
question_text: Which of the following describes a universal agent?
explanation: A universal agent has broad authority to act on behalf of the principal, such as a person with a power of attorney or a conservator. A special or specific agent has limited scope of authority.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: Which of the following acts requires commercial buildings to be accessible to people with disabilities, such as those who use wheelchairs?
explanation: The Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) requires commercial buildings to be accessible to people with disabilities, such as those who use wheelchairs.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 added which protected class to federal fair housing law?
explanation: The Housing and Development Act of 1974 added sex as a protected class, which helped prevent discrimination and sexual harassment for individuals seeking housing.

topic: Financing
question_text: Which of the following statements about the promissory note is true?
A: A promissory note is a negotiable instrument and can be transferred to a secondary holder who has the right to enforce the note's terms.
B: A promissory note isn't a legal document.
C: A promissory note isn't transferable, so it must be held by the original lender until paid in full.
D: A promissory note serves as collateral for a mortgage loan.
explanation: The promissory note is evidence of the debt that specifies the borrower's financial obligations. Collateral for the note is typically the property on which the loan is made. It's a negotiable instrument.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: If competitors agree to do this, what action is an antitrust violation?
B: Increase the number of competitors in the field
explanation: Any agreement that restricts trade, discourages competition, or restricts choices for the consumer is a violation of antitrust law.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: What's the term for a lender refusing to lend in a specific area, often based on the area's demographic make-up?
explanation: When lenders determine where they will lend based on a neighborhood's racial or other protected class status, it's redlining, and it's illegal.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
subtopic: Licensing and Continuing Education Requirements and Procedures
question_text: As a real estate professional, you must guard against ______.
A: Consumers who falsely accuse you of an antitrust violation
B: Even the perception of an antitrust violation
C: Only explicit evidence of an antitrust violation
D: Only those whose actions directly harm your ability to compete
explanation: null

topic: Financing
question_text: Which of the following statements is true about the secondary mortgage market?
A: It controls the flow of the local money supply.
C: It packages loans and sells them to investors.
D: Mortgage-backed securities are offered by credit unions.
explanation: The secondary mortgage market packages loans and sells them to investors. This creates additional funds to purchase more loans from the primary market.

topic: Financing
question_text: When a buyer takes over the seller's original loan with the lender's permission, what is this called?
explanation: Buyers can assume an existing loan with the lender's permission.

topic: Practice of Real Estate and Disclosures, Including Specialty Areas
question_text: What is the name of the standard form that allows sellers of residential property to provide buyers with disclosures required by statute?
B: The Real Estate Transfer Disclosure Statement
explanation: The Real Estate Transfer Disclosure Statement contains disclosures and language as required by statute.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Which of the following defines the term 'lis pendens'?
A: A legal notice that a lawsuit is pending that affects the title of a property
B: A legal term that means "it depends" and requires a certain minimum sales price of the property.
C: A notice that notifies potential buyers of a pending lease
D: A public listing and notice of foreclosure of a property.
explanation: Lis pendens is a legal notice that a lawsuit is pending that affects the title of a property.

topic: Financing
question_text: Which type of mortgage has an interest rate that remains constant over the life of the loan?
explanation: Since the total principal and interest payment remain the same, the loan payment remains relatively stable on a fixed rate loan (taxes and insurance are usually figured in, so the payment may adjust periodically).

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: Which type of survey system is also known as the public land survey system (PLSS)?
explanation: The rectangular survey system is also known as the public land survey system (PLSS) and is regulated by the Bureau of Land Management under the U.S. Department of the Interior.

topic: Property Ownership and Land Use Controls and Regulations
question_text: What is a Superfund site?
B: A property with "green" improvements that cost over $1 million
C: A site identified by the EPA as requiring remediation of hazardous waste spills
D: A site paid for by state taxes
explanation: A Superfund site is a site identified by the EPA as requiring clean-up of hazardous waste under CERCLA.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: Which approach to value measures the cost to produce a property, including land acquisition and construction costs?
explanation: The cost approach to finding appraised value measures value as a cost of production, including acquisition of the land and the construction costs.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
question_text: What types of transactions in California may require agency disclosure?
B: Residential and non-residential sales and leases
explanation: Agency disclosure is required for listings for sale or lease involving one- to four-unit residential properties and non-residential (commercial) properties.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Disclosure of Acting as Principal or Other Interest
question_text: You've been practicing real estate for a while and decide to purchase a property as an investment along with a business partner (who's not a real estate broker). Since you're a licensee, which of these actions must you take?
A: You must be represented by another broker in this transaction.
B: You must disclose your licensed status, any conflicts of interest, and any relevant facts that might affect the seller's decision to accept your offer to the seller.
C: You must offer the full list price, regardless of any other factors affecting the property value.
D: You must sign an agency agreement to represent your business partner before you can make an offer to the seller.
explanation: Your licensed status must be disclosed in writing, along with any conflicts of interest and all information that could affect the seller's decision to accept your offer, such as potential for profit.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
question_text: Harriet, an out-of-state licensee, is friends with Tonya, a licensee who works with Perfectly at Home. Harriet referred one of her buyer friends to Tonya, so Tonya plans to pay Harriet a referral fee. Which one of the following statements about this fee is true?
A: It's illegal for Tonya to pay an out-of-state licensee a referral fee.
B: Referral fees have no disclosure requirements.
C: Tonya must pay the fee directly to Harriet since Harriet is an out-of-state licensee.
D: Tonya must pay the referral fee through her brokerage firm to Harriet's brokerage firm.
explanation: As long as the payment goes through both brokerage firms, it's legal to pay an out-of-state licensee a referral fee. Tonya would only need to disclose the compensation if she were receiving the referral fee.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: Which of the following items directly influences real estate supply?
explanation: Supply is directly influenced by construction of new homes, conversion of existing properties to residences, and construction costs.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: Which of the following best describes the state of the market during the expansion phase of the real estate cycle?
A: High but stabilized unemployment and a high number of foreclosures
B: Increases in hiring, employment, and public confidence, and lots of buyers in the market
C: Properties selling at inflated prices, many buyers in the market, and lots of new construction
D: Unemployment increasing, prices falling, and foreclosures on the rise
explanation: Expansion is when activity starts to really pick up. Companies are hiring, so unemployment decreases. Higher employment means more buyers in the market and more overall public confidence.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: Clark works for Acme Bank and asks for your assistance. He wants you to look at a property that's about to go into foreclosure and provide him with a report on its current marketability and an approximate market value. What's Clark most likely asking you to provide?
explanation: Broker's price opinions are estimates of price in case the lender must take over the property and sell it to an investor or on the market.

topic: Property Valuation and Financial Analysis
question_text: Which of the following actions toward an appraiser would be considered improper?
A: Asking an appraiser to consider additional, appropriate property information
B: Asking an appraiser to correct errors in the appraisal report
C: Asking an appraiser to remove information about adverse property conditions from an appraisal report
D: Giving an appraiser additional details, substantiation, or explanation for the appraiser's value conclusion
explanation: Real estate licensees can ask appraisers to consider additional (relevant) information and to correct errors in reports. They cannot ask an appraiser to hide or remove information relevant to the value, such as adverse property conditions.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
question_text: Candace and Phil Tolson listed their home for sale with Trent Richards, the broker for Richards Homes. Sadly, Trent became incapacitated due to a car accident. What's the status of the listing agreement?
A: Because the listing agreement is with the brokerage firm, the agreement continues.
B: The agreement terminates by operation of law.
C: The brokerage firm can agree to terminate the agreement if the Tolsons choose to not work with another agent.
D: The Tolsons may choose to terminate the agency agreement.
explanation: Because the broker has become incapacitated, the listing agreement terminates by operation of law.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Law, Definition and Nature of Agency Relationships, Types of Agencies, and Agents
question_text: A couple at an open house ask a licensee for a flyer containing information about the property. What is the licensee's relationship with the couple?
explanation: No agency agreement exists in this scenario, so no client relationship has been created. The couple are customers.

topic: Laws of Agency and Fiduciary Duties
subtopic: Law, Definition and Nature of Agency Relationships, Types of Agencies, and Agents
question_text: April and Wayne are the buyer and seller of a condo, respectively. April is represented by Steve. Wayne is represented by Wendy. Who are the principal(s) in this transaction?
explanation: April and Wayne are the principals. They are both parties to the transaction.
